product_overview: KAIZEN is a cinematic Stranger Things-themed web portal for RIT Polytechnic Tech Fest, providing a public interface for event exploration, registration, and schedule viewing, alongside a comprehensive Admin Panel for event management.
core_goals: Create an engaging, cinematic themed website reflecting the Stranger Things 80s horror aesthetic.
Provide a seamless public user experience to explore events, register for competitions, and view festival schedule.
Implement a robust multi-step registration process with payment verification and real-time validation.
Deliver a secure admin panel for managing events, registrations, schedules, queries, and application settings.
Ensure responsiveness and performance optimization for smooth operation across devices.
Maintain high standards of data integrity and error handling throughout the application.
key_features: Stranger Things inspired landing page with cinematic intro animation, hero section, event countdown, and featured content.
Event exploration modal with detailed event information and easy navigation.
Multi-step registration system capturing personal, academic info and payment uploads with validations.
Schedule viewing interface grouping events by festival day in a timeline format.
Admin dashboard displaying registrations, revenue, and event counts.
Event management interface for creating, editing, and deleting events with detailed attributes.
Registration management allowing viewing, filtering, approving/rejecting payments, and data export.
Schedule builder with drag-and-drop or list functionality for event timeline creation.
Contact form with validation and an admin query management system.
Legal pages including terms of service, privacy policy, and refund policy.
SEO and metadata management for improved search engine presence.
Performance optimizations including image loading and caching.
Protected admin routes with authentication and authorization.
user_flow_summary: Public users land on the homepage, experience a cinematic intro animation which can be skipped, and then access main content sections.
Users explore events via modal listings, view details, and navigate to register for their chosen event.
Public users proceed through a multi-step registration form with validation and payment screenshot upload, culminating in submission to the backend.
Users view event schedules organized by days via a timeline interface.
Admins log in via a secure admin login, access the dashboard, and manage events, registrations, schedules, queries, reports, and settings through dedicated interfaces.
Admins approve or reject registration payments and can export registration data as CSV files.
Users can submit inquiries via the contact form, which admins can view and manage.
Site visitors navigate legal information through dedicated pages.
validation_criteria: Intro animation plays correctly on first load and can be skipped by the user.
Registration form validates inputs in real-time and successfully submits data to Supabase backend.
Admin authentication correctly restricts access to protected routes, redirecting unauthorized users.
Admin dashboard displays accurate registration counts, revenue figures, and event metrics.
Event creation, editing, deletion functions work reliably in the admin panel.
Payment approvals and rejections correctly update registration status and reflect in reports.
Schedule builder allows intuitive timeline creation and edits persist correctly.
Contact form validates inputs and submits queries to admin backend for management.
No crashes, black screens or broken navigation exist across the site, especially on mobile devices.
SEO metadata is correctly applied and performance optimizations reduce load times effectively.
